Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Engineered Success
Reviews.Content: Top notch value. The i5 processor is a big plus and a noticeable difference from my last PC. The computing experience is elevated using this machine. The aluminum finish gives this a nice clean cut look. The battery life is 3.5 hrs which is excellent considering the power of the machine. The beats audio sound system is a pleasant touch when viewing multimedia. Also for those who are tired with all the "log-ins" online the fingerprint reader is a great bonus that can automatically sign you in with one swipe of the finger. With all the features, this laptop can go toe to toe with any other 17" laptop on the market and is drastically cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Mandy
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop and after haveing an Acer for so long this laptop really makes you relize what quality and performance HP gives in thier PC's.It has a fingerprint reader which is so nifty cause I just scan my finger to log on to any website or enter my computer super security.This laptop is wi-max ready which is helpfull for anyone who needs long distance internet.The Silver titianium shell is durable and pretty.This is the nicest laptop anyone can get for the price;Also consumer report's gives HP laptops Dv7 modle notebooks 74 out of 100.

Reviews.Title: Great Comp
Reviews.Author: Tiff Taff TX
Reviews.Content: I have had this computer for 4 months now and I love it. For one thing, I love the exterior design. Be forewarned however, if you have you laptop in your room like I do and you don't turn in off every night, the HP symbol on the back glows... VERY bright, I have to set something on top of it to block out the light so I can sleep (I haven't checked, but there might be a setting to turn it off).When you lift the lid of the laptop, you have a very neat and tidy layout. The screen is huge, so there is enough room on the keyboard to have a numlocks pad. I also like the mouse pad. You can use two fingers to scroll and you can also zoom in and out on any screen (I just tested this on the desktop too, and it changes the size of your desktop icons when you do that). On my older laptop, the finger pad, left and right buttons were all separate, but on this HP it is all on one pad, so that took some getting used to for me.I also like having the finger scanner. I use it to log on to the computer quickly - no more typing in user passwords. You can also use it to log on to other websites, such as skype, wellsfargo, hotmail, gmail, facebook, etc. HOWEVER!!!!!: DON'T EXPECT TO BE ABLE TO USE THIS FEATURE IF YOU ARE A GOOGLE CHROME USER!!! I hear it works on internet explorer and firefox, but as of YET, it is not compatible with google chrome. Personally, I can live without the finger scanner to log in to various sites until chrome gets this worked out - I have no intention of switching to another browser.The Webcam is FANTASTIC! I love it. Very high quality. It even has some fun features that come with it; faces, hats, drawing. It's cute. The microphone is also amazing. It will even pick up a very quiet whisper.The graphics are beautiful, and the colors are very vivid. I am not a huge computer gamer, I just play Halo and Guild Wars and a lot of minigames on bored.com, but everything looks great while I play.The speakers are good. I think the associate at Best Buy was right when he said that in order to use the Beats Audio to its full potential, you would have to  get some external speakers or listen through headphones. But when I'm walking around the house, the speakers are good enough on their own.USB plugs are on the side, not on the back. I like it when they are on the backside of the computer, because whatever you are plugging into the computer would be out of the way, but that's not possible with this computer because of the battery. It also only has 3 USB plugs.The computer itself is also quite quiet. As I sit here now, even with multiple programs running and without the computer even being plugged in, it is very quiet - just the faintest whisper of a fan.And the battery life is long. Probably about 7 hours. I usually leave it unplugged on the kitchen table and it will last for about a week without it needing to be plugged in - so long as I use the battery saving preference and close the lid when I'm done with it.Before I decided to get this computer, I read the good and bad reviews from multiple sites. From my experience, it seems that people who wrote the bad reviews probably had a defective machine which is a risk with anything you buy, whether you're buying a laptop or xbox or a washing machine.All in all, I love my computer. And this computer has turned me into a HP FanGirl. After this computer I got a HP External Harddrive, mouse, and my bf and I just bought a new HP Printer yesterday.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: HankT
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great PC.  It has performance, value, attractive, and reliable.  I've bought 2 of them (one for me, one for my neice).

Reviews.Title: Not so good after a year long use
Reviews.Author: Tihomir Lerner "DamienZG"
Reviews.Content: When I got this laptop it cost 1.160 CAD, not a bad price for 1TB drive, Blu-Ray player (unnecessary really as it turns out), 6GB RAM, etc. It looked beautiful, elegant, and it was powerful. I especially liked the Beats audio.But with time and the usage the shoddy built started to show its true face. Mind you, I used my laptop primarily as a desktop replacement which means it was not moved around much, it stayed on my desk 90% of the time.The battery died before the warranty expired, HP refused to replace it because laptop was bought in Canada and I live in Europe.The metal top case is coming apart, the metal screen encasing is slowly ungluing as well.The keyboard was faulty from the beginning, the space bar (I think this is probably the one of the most used and crucial keys) did not respond well - had to hit it hard a couple of times to take effect - the rest of the keys feel like they were all slid slightly to the left and are not responsive enough. Actually, I never really liked using the keyboard and would attach another one for daily and heavy use.This laptop with its shiny looks (especially in pictures) and a long and impressive specs sheet sounds like a good choice but after a year long usage it falls quite short. HP tends to use low quality components across the board which starts to show over time.Because of all this and their horrible customer service I will never even look at another HP product.P.S. My model is HP Pavilion DV7 4246ca.

Reviews.Title: HP dv7-4285dx
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this laptop. Flight Simulator X works great. Windows 7 is so much better then Vista, it works! Battery life is super long I have gone about 6 hours without the need to plug it in. It has room for a dual hard drive witch I like. The i5 processor is really fast. I love the Beats Audio System it sounds super.

Reviews.Title: Great Computer!
Reviews.Author: D. Richardson "RETIRED"
Reviews.Content: Beautiful computer that is fast, sounds great and offers lots of options.  My son is the primary user and he loves all the features.  If you want a new laptop, get this one.  It is the best of all that I have reviewed.  He loves to play PS3 games using his laptop, listening to music, videos, etc.  Nice entertainment laptop.  Lots of memory and speed. No problems to date.

Reviews.Title: extremely happy
Reviews.Author: newmindmds
Reviews.Content: purchased this coomputer for my wife on her birthday. she was so excited to have a new toy. our old computer was over 10 years old and very slow. she  was smiling as soon as she saw the box. did all the set for her while she was at work so when she got home she could play with it all night. shipping was fast came in original packaging. so far no problems with the computer every thing works as advertised. fast processor and we love the finger identification feature. hp did a wonderful job putting this together. one happy wife makes a happy husband.

Reviews.Title: Broken in less then a year.
Reviews.Author: WindyApril
Reviews.Content: I bought my laptop a year ago and I am just replacing the hard drive right now. I am not a huge computer person and I think I maybe used it twenty hours since owning it and it is already broken. Its been a pain in the ass to replace Geek Squad is almost useless and then I had to call the HP store to buy parts because Geek Squad was incapable.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Danielle Hoskins "Ethan Hunts mommy:)"
Reviews.Content: I love my new laptop. Bought at Best Buy and have not had any problems. It works super fast and handles everything I need it to do. I love the fingerprint reader. It logs me onto my accounts or websites without having to remember all my passwords. I love the graphics and screen savers already on the laptop. I only have one dislike and thats I am having trouble finding a laptop carrying bag to fit my 17.3 inch. Most go up to 17inch.

Reviews.Title: BEST laptop I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: jonathon green
Reviews.Content: I have had this computer 3 years now and would buy it again if I could go back and do it all over. This computer has a great processor, pristine picture out of the crisp led screen and best of all is the sound package. This packs a punch for lap top sound quality. The only issue I've had is the fan lost connection. I bought it from another retailer and had purchased their extended warranty so I had it fixed in no time without cost.pixels after 3 years are just as they were the day I bought it. Only complaint is the keyboard isn't backlit so at nights when your surfing the web with your partner next to you and you can't turn the lights on, a backlit keyboard would be a game changer. Overall though  I LOVE this laptop

Reviews.Title: Value only at the beginning..
Reviews.Author: Douglas Chacin
Reviews.Content: The features for the money is very, very good. But after a year of mostly internet brousing use, the computer has failed. The fan works only at times. Two of the IT people from my office looked at it. Their veredict, buy another laptop since it is not worth spending on this one. Now I learned from them that HP home laptops have the lowest rate of reliability of all laptops. I believe it, as I type this my wife enjoys her 5 years old Toshiba.Save yourself the trouble. Not all that glitters is gold.

Reviews.Title: Lots of lemons
Reviews.Author: A. Godlewski
Reviews.Content: I had trouble with my first 2 and even the third isn't very dependable.  The first hard drive went bad after a week.  The second would connect to the internet, but would only open web pages about 10% of the time.  (we had 2 other computers connected to the wireless network so it wasn't a modem problem).  The third takes anywhere from 1-4 minutes to connect to the internet after every time the computer goes to sleep.  It just doesn't seem solid or dependable.

Reviews.Title: so bad
Reviews.Author: Mohamed M.
Reviews.Content: it's not 640GB Hard Drive it is only 80GB on it and no wireless card found on it and this laptop have only 4G ram not 6G and screen flashing and many drivers not installed

Reviews.Title: Hideous audio and no aspect ratio
Reviews.Author: M. Fisher "MJF"
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to getting this unit when the Best Buy salesman showed it to me. The specs looked great, and I even returned my unopened mid-range HP Laptop to get this unit. A mistake probably!  The unit has no ability to maintain aspect ratio!  That means when you play a game or run an older software app you will have to view it in a small box, or have the app/game distorted/stretched over the widescreen!  My 5 year old HP laptop doesn't suffer from this!  When you find the settings for "preserve aspect ratio" they "don't take."  The unit refuses to keep the setting. 2 hours on the phone to HP, two different techs - they're baffled!  No answer.  Add to that the horrible distortion of sound through the laptop speakers (it's bearable through headphones but still not great) and this is simple junk!  Bejeweled 3 and Bejeweled Blitz are completely distorted.  Adjusting various sound settings (tone in Windows, even killing the EQ in beat audio's settings) either muffled or distorted the speaker sound. Unbelievable.  Fixes on the internet for the aspect ratio either don't work, or involve tedious settings-fumbling in 3D elements in ATI control panel, and only for 1 game at a time. There is no solution for the sound horror. All drivers updated. Avoid this unit, plain and simple.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i5 Processor 2.53GHz
6GB DDR3 RAM
640GB 5400RPM Hard Drive
17.3-Inch Screen, Radeon
Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit
ProductInfo.Name: HP Pavilion dv7-4285dx Entertainment Laptop - Intel Core i5-460M Processor/ 6GB DDR3 Memory/ 640GB Hard Drive
